content: 1999 Singaporean TV series or program ***Stepping Out*** ([Chinese](/wiki/Simplified_Chinese_characters): 出路) is a 1999 Singaporean Mandarin drama series adapted from *Stepping Out: The Making Of Chinese Entrepreneurs* by Chan Kwok Bun and Claire Chiang See Ngoh. It reran several times like in 2006, 2019 and in 2021. It stars [Xie Shaoguang](/wiki/Xie_Shaoguang),[Cynthia Koh](/wiki/Cynthia_Koh), [Ivy Lee](/wiki/Ivy_Lee_(actress)), [Tay Ping Hui](/wiki/Tay_Ping_Hui), [Terence Cao](/wiki/Terence_Cao) and [Yvonne Lim](/wiki/Yvonne_Lim) as the casts of the series. The series focuses on the Chinese immigrant experience in [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore), and their rough, hard ascent (along with the rest of Singapore) to the present state of wealth and riches that is unprecedented in Singaporean history. The drama begins in China and spans roughly three decades. It was produced following the success of the 1997 period drama *[The Price of Peace](/wiki/The_Price_of_Peace)*. The story begins at the start of the [Chinese Civil War](/wiki/Chinese_Civil_War) during the 1920s. The chaos and upheaval which entailed caused many Chinese to migrate to [Southeast Asia](/wiki/Southeast_Asia), mainly Malaysia and Singapore, and sets the background for the series. The [Hock Lee bus riots](/wiki/Hock_Lee_bus_riots) and [Chinese middle schools riots](/wiki/Chinese_middle_schools_riots) of the 1950s were referenced and clips of the actual incidents were shown. ## Plot It is the 1920s, a time of great chaos in [China](/wiki/Republic_of_China_(1912-1949)). Poverty was rampant in many regions, forcing many people to seek their fortune in the fabled Southern region known collectively as [Nanyang](/wiki/Nanyang_(geographical_region)). The story begins with three young men from the [Fujian](/wiki/Fujian) province. A poor oyster collector named Chen Xia (Terence Cao) wishes to marry his childhood sweetheart, Hong Dou (Cynthia Koh), but struggles to make ends meet. The son of a wealthy tea plantation owner, Jia Fu (Xie Shaoguang) is a wastrel. Lazy and childish, the only saving grace to his character is his thoughtless generosity. In his naivete he loses his inheritance and is left with nothing but the support of his industrious wife, Ju (Ivy Lee). After Tian's (Chunyu Shanshan) father dies on the trip to Nanyang, his widowed mother and his two siblings are forced to live a life of scavenging for food in the wilderness. After his sister is killed and his brother goes missing, he is hired by a rich merchant. His new employer is cruel and his meekness makes him an easy target for bullying, but he finds himself attracted to the man's second wife, Hai Yan (Yvonne Lim). Despite the disparity between their situations and personalities, they each find themselves making the trip to the port of [Singapore](/wiki/Singapore) in Nanyang all with the same purpose: To seek a way out of their circumstances and a better future. ## Cast - [Xie Shaoguang](/wiki/Xie_Shaoguang) as Zhang Jiafu - [Terence Cao](/wiki/Terence_Cao) as Chen Xia - [Cynthia Koh](/wiki/Cynthia_Koh) as Hongdou - [Tay Ping Hui](/wiki/Tay_Ping_Hui) as Liu Mei - [Yvonne Lim](/wiki/Yvonne_Lim) as Hai Yan - [Ivy Lee](/wiki/Ivy_Lee_(actress)) as Ah Ju - Chunyu Shanshan [zh] - [Chen Huihui](/wiki/Chen_Huihui) ## Accolades OrganisationYearCategoryNomineeResultRef[Star Awards](/wiki/Star_Awards)1999[Best Actor](/wiki/Star_Awards_for_Best_Actor)[Terence Cao](/wiki/Terence_Cao)Nominated[Xie Shaoguang](/wiki/Xie_Shaoguang)Won[Best Actress](/wiki/Star_Awards_for_Best_Actress)[Cynthia Koh](/wiki/Cynthia_Koh)Won[Ivy Lee](/wiki/Ivy_Lee_(actress))Nominated[Best Supporting Actor](/wiki/Star_Awards_for_Best_Supporting_Actor)[Tay Ping Hui](/wiki/Tay_Ping_Hui)WonChunyu Shanshan [zh]Nominated[Best Supporting Actress](/wiki/Star_Awards_for_Best_Supporting_Actress)[Yvonne Lim](/wiki/Yvonne_Lim)Nominated[Chen Huihui](/wiki/Chen_Huihui)Nominated[Best Drama Serial](/wiki/Star_Awards_for_Best_Drama_Serial)*Stepping Out*Won[Best Theme Song](/wiki/Star_Awards_for_Best_Theme_Song)"我吃得起苦" by [Power Station](/wiki/Power_Station_(Taiwanese_band))Won2007Top 5 Favourite Dramas 最喜爱的五大连续剧—N/aWon Top 5 - *Stepping Out* (Chinese) Preceded by ***[Stand by Me](/wiki/Stand_by_Me_(TV_series))* (/wiki/Star_Awards_1998)****[*Star Awards* for Best Drama Serial](/wiki/Star_Awards_for_Best_Drama_Serial) *Stepping Out* 1999**Succeeded by ***[Hainan Kopi Tales](/wiki/Hainan_Kopi_Tales)* (/wiki/Star_Awards_2000)** This Singaporean television-related article is a stub.
